{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3684828,"name":"","username":"Nimble","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/a5b964/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-19T17:15:37.331Z","cooked":"

With the template CTRE swerve generated code, what is the advantage of using OpenLoopVoltage or Velocity? From what I understand, OpenLoopVoltage is an open loop while Velocity is closed. I’d assume tuning the closed loop would be more time consuming, but does it offer any real advantages?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-07-19T17:15:37.331Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":90,"readers_count":89,"score":58.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":504418,"topic_slug":"ctre-driverequesttype-openloopvoltage-vs-velocity","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56803,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/ctre-driverequesttype-openloopvoltage-vs-velocity/504418/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3684831,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-19T17:19:56.442Z","cooked":"

It depends on what you’re trying to do, and to some degree on driver preference.

For autonomous routines you almost always want to close the velocity loop or else your pathfinding accuracy will suffer.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-07-19T17:20:24.666Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":90,"readers_count":89,"score":23.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":504418,"topic_slug":"ctre-driverequesttype-openloopvoltage-vs-velocity","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/ctre-driverequesttype-openloopvoltage-vs-velocity/504418/2","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3684833,"name":"Rahul Yarlagadda","username":"Knufire","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/knufire/{size}/67820_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-19T17:26:23.511Z","cooked":"
Oblarg:

For autonomous routines you almost always want to close the velocity loop or else your pathfinding accuracy will suffer.

This, we use open loop for any velocity resulting from a driver input and closed loop for anything that’s calculated in code.

We are also using open loop from a driver input. Otherwise it becames too hard to tune it.
